messages.text:
Hi, there's a cool discussion here: <https://julialang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/240884-soss.2Ejl/topic/MTK.2C.20Soss.2C.20Catlab.3A.20Partially.20Symbolic.20Computing>

About the symbolic/DSL ecosystem  (modeling toolkit, soss etc) and where gen can fit in (genify vs MTK tracing, GFI and sampling for MTK problems etc)

attachments.title: JuliaLang
attachments.text: This is the Zulip server for the Julia programming language community. We ask anyone joining to adhere to the Julia Code of Conduct. | To learn more about Julia, check out <https://julialang.org/>, or just come ask us here! | You can reach out to the admins of this Zulip by sending a direct message to @zulip-admins.

elements.text: Hi, there's a cool discussion here:
About the symbolic/DSL ecosystem  (modeling toolkit, soss etc) and where gen can fit in (genify vs MTK tracing, GFI and sampling for MTK problems etc)

messages.text: Hi everyone, I’m not sure if this is the correct place to ask questions. But I’m wondering why Gen doesn’t have a built-in NUTS sampler similar to those provided by Turing or Pyro.

elements.text: Hi everyone, I’m not sure if this is the correct place to ask questions. But I’m wondering why Gen doesn’t have a built-in NUTS sampler similar to those provided by Turing or Pyro.
